title: Good Agricultural Practices Training Graduation Ceremony

tasks.task: Attend a graduation ceremony for agricultural training
subtasks: Listen to speeches during the ceremony
Receive a certificate as a graduation礼

tasks.task: Deliver a speech at the ceremony
subtasks: Emphasize bilateral collaboration between Taiwan and St. Lucia

tasks.task: Conduct a workshop as part of the training program
Commend participants and highlight project goals
subtasks: Stress the importance of sustainable farming
Address current agricultural challenges and their impacts
Outline the project's objectives related to food security and nutrition
Praise the contribution of the farming community

tasks.task: Celebrate the completion of the training program
subtasks: Announce the next steps for the project
Acknowledge the ongoing collaboration between partners

tasks.task: Attend a graduation ceremony for the Good Agricultural Practices Training
Deliver a speech at the ceremony
Conduct a workshop as part of the training program
Promote local purchase, diversify, and increase domestic production

But wait, it's unclear if every participant gave a speech or conducted a workshop. The speeches were presumably by the ambassador, minister, etc. So maybe the participants' main task is to attend and graduate, hence the first MAINTASK. If the transcript is about them, then the rest are maybe not directly their tasks. So perhaps only include the tasks related to their participation.
If the transcript was about an official’s experience, such as the ambassador, then their MAINTASK would be to deliver a speech, and subtasks would include the preparation.
Attend a graduation ceremony for a Good Agricultural Practices Training

The other MAINTASKs (speeches, conducting workshops) would be by the officials, which are not the participants’, unless they were asked to speak. But typically, only a select few would deliver speeches at such an event. In the transcript, the ambassador and the minister gave speeches.

attend, graduate, and then benefit from the knowledge. If the transcript had more about participant’s actions, like applying the techniques or operating equipment, then that would be included. But since the transcript is mostly about the event, these are the best estimations of the tasks.
